items.translated_title: Samsung to hold its Galaxy S26 event on February 25

images.alt: SEOUL, SOUTH KOREA - AUGUST 25: The Samsung logo is displayed at the Samsung office on August 25, 2017 in Seoul, South Korea. Prosecutors are seeking a 12-year jail sentence. Lee, de facto chief of South Korean conglomerate, faces five charges connecting the bribery scandal involving ousted former President Park Geun-hye and her confidant Choi Soon-sil. The verdict affects the business of Samsung, which has launched new Galaxy Note 8 smartphone to wipe out the misery of exploding Note 7 last year. (Photo by Chung Sung-Jun/Getty Images)

items.content: Samsung is going to launch S26 lineup just before Mobile World Congress (MWC).

items.content: According to The New York Times, which reports that it heard the meeting, Musk told employees that xAI needs a lunar manufacturing facility, a factory on the moon that will build AI satellites and fling them into space via a giant catapult.

items.translated_title: Google sent personal and financial information of student journalist to ICE

items.title: Former Tesla product manager wants to make luxury goods impossible to fake, starting with a chip
items.creator: Ivan Mehta
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Former Tesla product manager wants to make luxury goods impossible to fake, starting with a chip
items.content: The startup claims that it has developed a "hack-proof" chip that can't be bypassed by devices like Flipper Zero, a widely available hacking tool that can be used to tamper with wireless systems. These chips are linked with digital certificates to verify the authenticity of the products.

items.translated_title: Singapore says China-backed hackers targeted its four largest phone companies
